response_parsed.title: Observing Machine Learning Training Loops with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to monitor machine learning (ML) training loops within a FastAPI application built on Python 3.12+, using the `uvicorn` asynchronous server and `fastapi-metrics` for monitoring.
key_points: Use `FastAPI` to create an API that handles the ML model training loop
Integrate `uvicorn` as the asynchronous server for running your FastAPI application
Employ `fastapi-metrics` for monitoring key metrics during the training process
Set up a custom meter or gauge to visualize training progress
Utilize API routes to check and analyze training metrics in real time

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()

# Your ML model training loop goes here...

! pip install fastapi-metrics

# Import and initialize fastapi-metrics in your FastAPI app...

import fastapi_metrics
fastapi_metrics.init_app(app)

# Define a custom gauge for tracking training progress...
gauge = fastapi_metrics.Gauge("training_progress", description="Training progress during model loop")

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial
`uvicorn` version should be compatible with Python 3.12 (0.15.x or higher recommended)
Ensure you have the latest `fastapi-metrics` installed using pip
caveats: Remember to update your FastAPI application's documentation on how to use and interpret monitoring metrics
It is essential to profile and optimize your ML training loop for best performance with the given solution
Consider integrating a logging library for additional insights into the training process
